item.title: Coronavirus: Boris Johnson to launch Covid-19 alert system
item.description: Boris Johnson is also expected to unveil a new message to "stay alert, control the virus, save lives".

item.title: Boris Johnson's lockdown speech: What to watch out for
item.description: Boris Johnson's address from No 10 is expected to set out a "roadmap" for easing lockdown restrictions.

item.title: Coronavirus: UK sent 50,000 Covid-19 samples to US for testing
item.description: The government says "operational issues" in the UK meant 50,000 samples had to be flown to US labs.

item.title: Coronavirus: PM to unveil Covid-19 alert system and call for BAME deaths inquiry
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus outbreak this morning.

item.title: Coronavirus: Obama says US response a 'chaotic disaster'
item.description: Ex-president strongly criticises successor Donald Trump over his handling of the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: Newcastle takeover: Moral values should prevail, Khashoggi's fiancee says
item.description: The fiancee of murdered journalist Jamal Khashoggi says Newcastle United and the Premier League must put moral values ahead of financial gains.

item.title: Prince of Wales hails Britain's postal workers during pandemic
item.description: Prince Charles praises their "dedication, resilience and hard work" in a letter left outside his home.

item.title: Coronavirus: Call for public inquiry into BAME death risk
item.description: More than 70 public figures sign an open letter to the prime minister calling for more transparency.

item.title: Coronavirus: Shops should reopen based on safety - retail chief
item.description: The British Retail Consortium says practical safety measures will protect staff and shoppers.

item.title: Coronavirus: Churches may not be back to normal by end of year
item.description: Social distancing could mean prayer books cannot be shared and people cannot sing, religious leaders say.

item.title: Coronavirus: Elon Musk vows to move Tesla factory in lockdown row
item.description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk says the firm will leave California after he is ordered to keep a factory shut.

item.title: The Papers: Rock 'n' roll hero dies and 'lockdown decision day'
item.description: Some papers report the PM will unveil a new coronavirus warning system in his speech this evening.

item.title: Coronavirus: Fifty million plastic pieces sifted from beach in lockdown
item.description: Artist Rob Arnold is spending his lockdown sifting 40 sacks of beach litter in Cornwall.

item.title: Coronavirus: The faces smiling behind the masks
item.description: Laura Fuchs is capturing New Yorkers who are trying to stay positive in the midst of the pandemic.

item.title: Coronavirus: Rainbow portraits thank the NHS
item.description: Photographer Tom Skipp's pictures of the many rainbows supporting the NHS across the city of Bristol.

item.title: Coronavirus: Volunteering at Calais' migrant camps
item.description: Tia has decided to work at a migrant camp in Calais instead of returning home to her family during lockdown.

item.title: The 1957 flu that killed one million people
item.description: In 1957 a new strain of flu emerged in East Asia and quickly spread around the world, killing a million people.

item.title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: The strange case of the choir that coughed in January
item.description: Dr John Wright is intrigued by some singers who became ill long before the UK's first known Covid-19 case.

item.title: Bundesliga: Derek Rae's guide to the German league
item.description: German football will be the first to restart in Europe - here's your guide to following it.

item.title: Coronavirus: The sex toy manufacturer making NHS gear
item.description: The BBC speaks to unexpected sources who are supplying PPE amid coronavirus shortages.

item.title: OCD: 'I spent 20 years preparing for the coronavirus pandemic'
item.description: How coping with OCD prepared one man for the challenges of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: "Can I get a mortgage if I'm only on 80% pay?"
item.description: As millions of people have their salaries cut, will mortgage providers lend based on reduced salary?

item.title: A Hero's Death? Fontaines DC confront the curse of the second album
item.description: The Dublin rock band had one of 2019's best albums - so what does the follow-up have in store?

item.title: Obituary: Little Richard, a flamboyant pioneer
item.description: The self-styled "king and queen of rock 'n' roll" - who inspired Elvis and The Beatles - dies at 87.

item.title: Dresden put entire squad in isolation - a week before German football restarts
item.description: Dynamo Dresden, who play in the second tier of German Football, have put their entire squad and coaching staff into two-week isolation after recording two new coronavirus cases.

item.title: Match of Their Day: Phil Neville picks his classic games
item.description: In this week's Match of Their Day, former Manchester United and Everton player Phil Neville selects his three favourite Premier League games.

item.title: Pro14 season resumption planned for late August
item.description: Plans are being considered to resume a curtailed Pro14 season on 22 August following the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: 'I feel fresher and healthier' - Hamilton enjoying parts of F1 break
item.description: Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton says he feels certain benefits from his enforced time away from Formula 1.

item.title: Gossip - Tottenham leading Man Utd in race for Meunier
item.description: Tottenham are ahead of Manchester United in the race for Thomas Meunier as the Red Devils consider replacements for David de Gea.

item.title: Dennis Bergkamp scores wonder goal for Netherlands against Argentina at 1998 World Cup
item.description: BBC Sport marks Dennis Bergkamp's birthday by looking back at his brilliant winning goal for the Netherlands against Argentina at the 1998 World Cup.

item.title: Match of Their Day: How Phil Neville knew his time at Manchester United was over
item.description: Phil Neville on how Kleberson and Eric Djemba-Djemba's arrivals at Man Utd forced him to visit Sir Alex Ferguson at home and work out his future.

item.title: Coronavirus: How might lockdown end and what will be the 'new normal'?
item.description: When the government eases restrictions, how will social and work life be different?

item.title: Coronavirus: Should the public wear face masks?
item.description: There is growing discussion about the potential benefits of the general public wearing masks.

item.title: Coronavirus: Intensive care and other key terms explained
item.description: Use our tool to check the meaning of key words and phrases associated with the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus: How lockdown is being lifted across Europe
item.description: As the UK looks to lift restrictions, how do other European countries plan to re-open after lockdown?

item.title: The FBI said I was my parents' stolen baby - but I found the truth
item.description: Foundling Paul Fronczak was given to a family whose baby had been stolen - but was he really their son?
